tit.cmt: 以下説明が続くので、英語説明を削除しました。

sen.j: 長禄の変（ちょうろくのへん）は、室町時代の長禄元年12月2日 (旧暦)（1457年12月27日）に赤松家遺臣らが後南朝の行宮を襲い、南朝の皇胤である尊秀王と忠義王（後南朝の征夷大将軍である）の兄弟を騙し討って、神璽を持ち去った事件。
sen.e: Choroku no hen was an incident occurred on December 27, 1457 in the Muromachi period when the former retainers of the Akamatsu family attacked angu (emperor's temporary palace) of Go-Nancho (administration established by descendants and former retainers of the Southern Dynasty to reestablish the Dynasty), made a surprise assault on the brothers of Sonshuo and Chugio who were descendants of the Southern Dynasty emperor (the latter was a seii taishogun (barbarian-subduing great general, usually abbreviated as shogun) of the Southern Dynasty), and took away Shinji (sacred jewel.)

sen.j: 嘉吉3年（1443年）の禁闕の変で、三種の神器の1つ『八尺瓊勾玉』は後南朝に持ち去られたままだった。
sen.e: "Yasakani no magatama" (curved jewels), one of the sanshu no jingi (the three imperial regalia), had been carried away and kept by the Go-Nancho in the Kinketsu incident in 1443.

sen.j: 嘉吉の乱で取り潰された守護大名赤松氏の再興を願う赤松家遺臣達（石見太郎、丹生屋帯刀、上月満吉など）は、この点に着目。
sen.e: The former retainers of the shugo daimyo (military governor) Akamatsu clan which had been broken in the Kakitsu disturbance (Taro IWAMI, Tatewaki NYUNOYA, Mitsuyoshi KOZUKI, and so forth) who determined to reestablish the clan noticed the fact.

sen.j: 大和国の豪族・小川弘光とともに、吉野の奥で北山・川上に本拠を置いていた後南朝の行宮を長禄元年12月2日_(旧暦)（1457年12月27日）に襲撃、南朝の皇胤である自天王と忠義王（後南朝の征夷大将軍である）の兄弟を討ち倒して、神璽を持ち去った。
sen.e: Together with Hiromitsu OGAWA, gozoku (powerful kin group) in Yamato Province, the retainers attacked the angu of the Go-Nancho, which based in Kitayama and Kawakami deep in Yoshino, on December 27, 1457, defeated the brothers of Jitenno and Chugio who were descendants of the Southern Dynasty emperor (the latter was a seii taishogun of the Go-Nancho), and took away the Shinji.

sen.j: しかし、後南朝を支持する吉野の民によって神璽を奪還された。
sen.e: But the Shinji was recaptured by the people who supported the Go-Nancho.

sen.j: 翌年の長禄2年（1458年）にも自天王の母の屋敷を襲い、再度神璽を持ち去った。
sen.e: The retainers attacked the residence of Jinenno's mother in the next year 1458, and took away the Shinji again.

sen.j: その後、約15年もの間、京都から持ち去られていた神璽の奪還成功を大いに認めた室町幕府は、赤松氏の再興を許した。
sen.e: Thereafter, the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) admired their success in taking back the Shinji, which had been carried away from Kyoto for 15 years, and permitted them to reestablish the Akamatsu clan.
